docs.snippet: The N.C.A.A. football rules committee dropped for now a proposal to penalize offenses for snapping the ball before 10 seconds have run off the 40-second play clock....
docs.lead_paragraph: The N.C.A.A. football rules committee dropped for now a proposal to penalize offenses for snapping the ball before 10 seconds have run off the 40-second play clock.
docs.abstract: NCAA football rules committee drops proposal to penalize offenses for snapping the ball before 10 seconds have run off the 40-second play clock; proposal was presented as a move to protect players from injuries by slowing fast-break offenses.

headline.main: N.C.A.A. Football Drops Rule to Slow Offenses

docs.snippet: Penn State offensive lineman John Urschel will routinely provide a look at his journey leading to the NFL draft on May 8 in a series of diary entries. The all-Big Ten, third-team AP All-American has a Master's degree in math and was awarded the Wi...
docs.lead_paragraph: Penn State offensive lineman John Urschel will routinely provide a look at his journey leading to the NFL draft on May 8 in a series of diary entries. The all-Big Ten, third-team AP All-American has a Master's degree in math and was awarded the William V. Campbell Trophy as college football's top scholar-athlete. The 6-foot-3, 315-pound guard's third entry gives a look at his return home to State College, Pa., after almost two months away to prepare for the combine.

headline.main: John Urschel's Diary: Road to the NFL Draft
headline.print_headline: John Urschel's Diary: Road to the NFL Draft

docs.snippet: TIGHE--Joseph M. 76 of Darien, CT, died Sunday, March 2. Born June 9, 1937 in Yonkers, NY, Joe raised six children in NY/CT with his wife, Elaine, of 51 years. An Iona College basketball player, Goal Club founder, Hall of Fame inductee and Contine...
docs.lead_paragraph: TIGHE--Joseph M. 76 of Darien, CT, died Sunday, March 2. Born June 9, 1937 in Yonkers, NY, Joe raised six children in NY/CT with his wife, Elaine, of 51 years. An Iona College basketball player, Goal Club founder, Hall of Fame inductee and Continental League football player. He held key management positions at RJR Nabisco, Heublein and Guinness. Upon retirement, Joe was a successful entrepreneur in the beverage industry. Winged Foot Golf Club was his home away from home. Joe is survived by his wife Elaine and children Julie Carrabino (Joe), Jill Kelly (Joe), Joe Tighe, Jr (Sabrina), Joy Cummiskey (James), Jayne Jepsen (Christian), Jeana Roche (Kevin) and 20 grandchildren. He cherished family and friends above all and will be forever in our hearts. Services: Gallagher Funeral Home, Greenwich, CT, Thursday March 6th 6-8pm, Friday March 7th 2-4pm and 6-8pm; Mass at the Church of St. Augustine, Larchmont, NY, on Saturday March 8th at 11am. In lieu of flowers, please send donations to the Joe Tighe Memorial Basketball Scholarship Fund at Iona College.

headline.main: Paid Notice: Deaths  TIGHE, JOSEPH M

docs.snippet: An Arkansas judge has admitted that he posted a series of anonymous online comments that critics say are racist, sexist and otherwise inappropriate, including one in which he revealed alleged details of confidential proceedings involving actress C...
docs.lead_paragraph: An Arkansas judge has admitted that he posted a series of anonymous online comments that critics say are racist, sexist and otherwise inappropriate, including one in which he revealed alleged details of confidential proceedings involving actress Charlize Theron's adoption of her son.
